commands.description: Changes the BUTFIRST of the list input to a given value.
Change the indexth item of array to be value
Outputs the current active area, as set by SETACTIVEAREA
Outputs a list whose members are the names of all files currently open.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-allopen.html

Outputs a list of three numbers: the minimum, default, and maximum number of inputs for the procedure whose name is the input. It is an error if there is no such procedure. A maximum of -1 means that the number of inputs is unlimited.
Outputs an array of size items, each of which initially is the empty list
Outputs a list whose members are the elements of the input array
Draws an opaque block (rectangle) of the given dimensions such that the turtle's current position is at the lower-left corner of the block
Copies part of the image and stores it in memory (or the clipboard, if BITINDEX is 0)
Cuts out part of the image and stores it in memory
Outputs current bitmap index, as set by SETBITINDEX. The default index is 0
Loads the bitmap specified by the filename input
Loads the bitmap specified by the filename input
Returns the bitmap mode that is set using setbitmode
Pastes the image that was BITCUT into the bitmap index specified by BITINDEX
Pastes the image that was BITCUT into the bitmap index specified by BITINDEX
Saves a picture of a portion of the drawing surface to a file as a bitmap
Output the width and height of the bitmap specified by the current BITINDEX
Creates a button
Deletes a button with the specified name
Enables a button

Outputs the result of applying a template (or several templates, see the section entitled Template-Based Iteration) repeatedly, with a given value filling the slot the first time, and the result of each application filling the slot for the following application.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-cascade.html
Outputs the result of invoking CASCADE with the same inputs
Erases all lines that the turtle has drawn on the graphics window.  The turtle's state(position, heading, pen mode, etc.) is not changed.

CLEARPALETTE does nothing. It has been kept for compatibility with old programs, but its function is no longer needed.  Historically, early versions of Microsoft Windows supported video displays that were limited to showing at most 256 colors at one time, although each of the colors used a full 24-bit range
Closes file
Closes all open files.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-closeall.html
Adds a string to a combobox
Creates a combobox
Deletes a combobox
Deletes a string from a combobox
Enables or disables the a combobox identifiedby name
Gets text from a combobox identified by the specified name
Sets text in a combobox

Ends the current interactive pause, returning to the context of the PAUSE invocation that began it. Exceptionally, the CONTINUE command can be used without its default input and without parentheses provided that nothing follows it on the instruction line.
Makes a new procedure called newname that is identical to procedure oldname, which may be a primitive
Outputs a list containing the results of template evaluations. Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-crossmap.html

Defines a procedure with name procname and definition text.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-define.html.  The closest analogue in WebLogo is 'to' but the translation is complicated by removal of square brackets and more.
Creates a window that is suitable for use as a dialog box
Enables a dialog
Displays a standard "Open" windows dialog box
Displays a standard "Save As" windows dialog box
Pitches the turtle's nose downward by the specified angle, measured in degrees (1/360 of a circle).  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-downpitch.html
Creates a new file whose name is the filename input, like OPENWRITE, and begins recording in that file everything that is read from the keyboard
Erases all unburied procedures, variables, and property lists from the workspace
Erases the procedures, variables, and property lists named in contentslist
commands.reason: WebLogo's Code Editor makes editing code more familiar and intuitive than using commands to erase it

commands.description: Erases all unburied variables from the workspace
Erases all unburied procedures from the workspace
Flood fills
commands.reason: WebLogo uses polyStart and polyEnd instead of fill because their meanings are more consistent with both 2D and 3D graphics

commands.description: Outputs a word or list, depending on the type of the data input, containing a subset of the members (for a list) or characters (for a word) of the input. Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-filter.html.  WebLogo's filter command is the closest translation but the template will need to be converted to a procedure.

Outputs the first item of the data input for which the value produced by evaluating conditiontemplate with that item in its slot is TRUE. Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-find.html
Returns the flood color.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-floodcolor.html
Command that evaluates the templatelist repeatedly, once for each item in datalist.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-foreach.html
Outputs a representation of the procedure procname in which formatting information is preserved
commands.reason: Open WebLogo's Code Editor and you'll see procedures in a format more familiar and intuitive than from any command

commands.description: Outputs a unique word each time it is invoked. The words are of the form G1, G2, etc. This is typically used to dynamically generate variable names.
Outputs the caption (title) of the window in focus.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-getfocus.html
commands.reason: WebLogo is not for creating graphical user interfaces or managing windows.

commands.description: Loads the GIF picture specified by the filename input
Save a picture of your work as a GIF image
Output the width and height of the GIF file that is specified by the filename input
Reads the value (or resistance across) the game port channel specified by mask
Rolls the turtle toward his left side by the specified angle, measured in degrees (1/360 of a circle).  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-leftroll.html
Adds to a listbox
Creates a listbox
Deletes a listbox
Enables a listbox
Gets a select from a listbox
Creates variables that are local to the currently running procedure.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-local.html
commands.reason: WebLogo supports localmake which should be used instead.  local declares variables but doesn't assign a value to them.  The only kind of variable that can be read without causing problems is one with a value.

commands.description: Returns a list of information about the machine
Outputs a word or list, depending on the type of the data input, of the same length as that data input.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-map.html
Outputs a list formed by evaluating templatelist repeatedly and concatenating the results using SENTENCE.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-map.se.html
Maximizes the window whose title matches caption
Lets you write Logo procedures to manipulate multimedia devices
Outputs a multi-dimensional array
Outputs an item of the multi-dimensional array
Replaces an item in a multi-dimensional array with a new value
Displays a dialog box with title in the title bar and message as the message
Closes the MIDI device that was opened with MIDIOPEN
Sends a MIDI message to the MIDI sequencer.
Opens the MIDI device and accesses it through a MIDI device driver.
Minimizes the window whose title matches caption.
Like make except with the name and value swapped
commands.reason: Not supported because it is rarely used and seems better removed in WebLogo than added

commands.description: Stops accepting incoming connection
Listens for and accepts new network connections on TCP port localport
Outputs the value of the last network data received on the connection created with NETACCEPTON
Initiates a connection over the network to the TCP port remoteport on remotemachinename
Sends data out the connection that was created with NETCONNECTON
Turns off networking in FMSLogo
Turns on networking in FMSLogo
Stops copying information to the dribble file and closes the file.

Opens the file named filename for writing.  If the file with the given filename already exists, the write position is initially set to the end of the old file. Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-openappend.html
Opens the file named filename for reading. Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-openread.html
Opens the file named filename for reading and writing.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-openupdate.html
Opens the specified file for writing
Outputs a list, the turtle's [roll pitch heading] each in degrees.  Learn more at: https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-orientation.html
Pauses execution and waits for the end-user or developer to click a button in a dialog before continuing.
Outputs a list containing the pen's position, mode, and
Outputs TRUE if the pen is down, FALSE if it's up
Outputs one of the words 'paint', 'erase', or 'reverse' according to the current pen mode
Outputs hardware-specific pen information
Tells the turtle to enter 'perspective' mode
Outputs the angle of the turtle's pitch in degrees.  Read more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-pitch.html
Completes the definition of a polygon.  Should be used with polystart.
Starts the definition of a new polygon
POLYVIEW erases the screen and renders all polygons defined with POLYSTART and POLYEND as shaded polygons
Prints the contents of the named property lists(s) to the current write stream
Prints the title lines of the named procedures, the definitions of the named variables, and the contents of the named property lists to the current write stream.
Displays a dialog box with title in the title bar and message as the message
If the input is a word, QUOTED outputs the word with a double-quote character (") appended to the front. Otherwise, QUOTED outputs whatever the input is.
Creates a radio button control
Outputs the state (TRUE or FALSE) of the radio button that is identified by name
Sets the state of the radio button that is identified by name to state
Reads a single character from the read stream and outputs it
Reads a line from the read stream (initially the popup dialog) and outputs that line as a list
Reads a line from the read stream and outputs that line as a word (without the end-of-line sequence)
If true, allows primitives to be erased.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-redefp.html
Outputs the result of applying the template to accumulate the items of the data input, two items at a time. Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-reduce.html
Outputs a copy of its input with duplicate members removed
Outputs a new thing that is equal to things with all members equal to thingtoremove removed
Restores (unminimizes or unmaximizes) the window whose title matches caption to the size and position it had before it was minimized or maximized
Rolls the turtle toward his right side by the specified angle, measured in degrees (1/360 of a circle).  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-rightroll.html
Outputs the angle of the turtle's roll in degrees.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-roll.html
Runs the specified instruction list.  The instruction list may come from a variable.
Creates a scrollbar
Deletes a scrollbar
Enables or disables a scrollbar
Output the current position of the scrollbar control that is identified by name
Set the range and current position of the scrollbar control that is identified by name
Scrolls the horizontal scrollbar of the "Screen" window.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-scrollx.html
commands.reason: WebLogo doesn't support scrollX because we want users and the graphical user interface to have full control over scrolling of the graphics screen.  This command would move some of that control to a running Logo program instead of the graphical user interface.

commands.description: Scrolls the vertical scrollbar of the "Screen" window.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-scrolly.html
commands.reason: WebLogo doesn't support scrollY because we want users and the graphical user interface to have full control over scrolling of the graphics screen.  This command would move some of that control to a running Logo program instead of the graphical user interface.

commands.description: Sets the active area for printing and saving pictures
Sets the current bitmap cut buffer according to index
Sets the current bitmap mode according to mode
Selects a window whose caption (or title) is caption
commands.reason: WebLogo is not for creating graphical user interfaces or managing windows

commands.description: Sets how POLYVIEW illuminates polygons
Orients the turtle to a new absolute orientation
Sets the pen's position, mode, and hardware-dependent charactaristics
commands.reason: setTurtleState sets a lot more than setPen and seems more useful.  In the 700+ examples written in WebLogo, I didn't see the need for a setPen or pencommand.  Adding a command for no reason other than to copy other Logo programming tools doesn't seem like a net benefit since it becomes an additional command to document, maintain for people maintaining the WebLogo project.  It also becomes an extra command to teach, and learn.  This effort is worth it if the command is something people will actually use reasonably frequently but pen and setPen seems like it would almost never need to be used.

commands.description: Pitches the turtle to a new absolute pitch.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-setpitch.html
Sets the pixel under the turtle to the color described by colorvector
Moves the turtle to an absolute X,Y coordinate.  setPos also adds the new point to vertex lists within 3D polygon paths that are started with polystart.
Sets the read stream to the file named filename
Rolls the turtle to a new absolute roll.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-setroll.html
Selects turtle index for control.
Shutoff a sound turned on by SOUNDON.
Shutoff a sound turned on by SOUNDON.
If assigned a list value in a file that is loaded by load, that value is run as an instruction list after loading
Creates a static text control.
Deletes(closes) the static control that is identified by the name.
Replaces the text of the static control identified by name with text..
Outputs the text of the procedure named procname in the form expected by define.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-text.html
Outputs the value of the variable whose name is the input word
Outputs the time since Windows started, measured in milliseconds
Outputs a list of pitch roll, heading to orient the turtle toward the specified position
Outputs the result of repeated evaluation of the template input
Unminimizes (restores) the window whose title matches caption
Pitches the turtle's nose upward by the specified angle, measured in degrees (1/360 of a circle).  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-uppitch.html
Delays further execution for about delay 1/60ths of a second
Tells the turtle to enter 'window' mode. Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-window.html
Creates a window
Deletes a window with the specified name
Opens the editor on the file with the given filename
Tells the turtle to enter 'wrap' mode. Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-wrap.html
Displays a dialog box with title in the title bar and question as the message
Sets the scale of the "Screen" window.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-zoom.html
commands.reason: WebLogo is not supporting it because it would take away some ability of the end-user to control zoom as the program runs.
